forum.name: Open Explorer
forum.intro:
Mission: As a group, identify 10 unique OER that can be used for open teaching in math and 10 instructional strategies or approaches to open teaching that involve students reusing, remixing, or revising OER.

Each participant must contribute at least one OER and one open strategy to the group mission.

Reply to the Open Explorer discussion thread below to share your OER.  In your forum post:

  • Identify one OER and one open strategy.
  • Specify which Rs you’re leveraging with the proposed strategy
  • Share what practices you think can be developed with the approach

Once the mission is accomplished (you have completed the activity), you will be able to view other participants’ responses.

Tips:

  • This mission is best accomplished by a Web search for OER and for resources created by the open community about teaching with OER. Use key words such as open pedagogy and OER instructional strategies.
  • OER of all types might provide important clues for this mission. Lesson plans might be particularly helpful. Use what you learned in Course 1 Open Your Classroom with OER to search for OER.
  • The OER you contribute to the mission could be related to any topic, but when you post you must specify how the OER relate to math instruction.
